answers.answer: Are you having your urine checked regularly for protein? Some swelling is normal, but it can also be a symptom of preeclampsia.

My ankles and feet did the same thing. Are you on your feet alot? If so that's the problem you have to sit down and elevate your feet above your heart. It took my feet and ankles two days to go back to normal because I was always on my feet moving, shaking and trying to stay active.

question: Is it normal to start swelling in legs/ankles/feet at this time? There is no sight of my ankles and my legs also look bigger.  :( forget putting my normal shoes on, they're so tight I can barely get them on!  I can't imagine having to deal with this for another 7 weeks, on top of the constant heartburn, fatigue, and irritability!!
title: 33 weeks swelling
